label: Description
value: Long scarf of crimson silk twill brocaded in multicolored cotton with deep end borders of a horizontal row of large close-set "cones," stylized floral guards bands top and bottom) and smaller detached "cones" in close-set horizontal rows on body of scarf. Silk and cotton floral galloon applied up long sides, which have been cut.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton Technique: twill weave

label: Description
value: White silk floral damask embroidered with scattered animals, birds and insects in colored silks and metal threads. With an embroidered obelisk surmounted by a coronet with serpents on either side. Composed of four smaller pieces, stitched together.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk Technique: embroidered on damask weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 169 x 49 cm (5 ft. 6 9/16 in. x 19 5/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Two panels of cotton, plain cloth, printed in red, copper plate. Chinoiserie design inspired by an opera by Gretry "panurge dans l'Isle des Lanternes," design horizontally arranged shows performers on a stage, processions, etc., personages in fantastic dress.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate

label: Description
value: Panel of linen printed in red showing a chinoiserie design inspired by the Opera Panurge dans l'Isle des Lanternes: comédie lirique en trois actes written by André Ernest Modeste Grétry (1741-1813) and first performed in 1785. The design shows processions of personages in fantastic dress and performers on a stage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Panel of cotton printed in red showing a design of women harvesting grapes; country folk dancing and courting; a man on the ground holding a bottle and a man beating a drum in front of an inn, with vessels of wine around him.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1952: Richard Cranch Greenleaf collection; 1952: acquired by the Museum.

value: Panel of cotton printed in red showing a design of women harvesting grapes; country folk dancing and courting; a man on the ground holding a bottle.

value: Panel of cotton printed in red showing a design of a woman harvesting grapes and a man beating a drum in front of an inn, with vessels of wine around him.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with field filled with medium-scale repeat of extremely stylized and angular flower and vase in trellis framework of diamonds with interlocking corners; wide border of smaller scale diamond framework enclosing diamonds. In torquoise, salmon, dark brown, white raw silk floss tufts knotted in dull gold silk floss.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered on plain weave; with knotted tufts
Design for Several Bays of a Public Building

label: Description
value: Front elevation; side elevation and plan of several bays of a public building. Four stories high on a podium or base; large openings alternating with small ones; gabled roof.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray wash on Bristol illustration board

label: Provenance
value: Ely Jacques Kahn; 1952: acquired by Museum
Frontispiece: Della Magnificenza Ed. Architettura Dei Romani

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Frontispiece to the plates. Title, above on a stone: "DELLA/MAGNIFICENZA/ED. ARCHITETTURA/DE' ROMANI/OPERA/DI.DIO. BATTISTA PIRANESI/SOCIO.DELLA REALE/ACCADEMIA/DEGLI.ANTIQUARI/DI.LONDRA." At upper left, and below: arms, insignia, standards, eagle, prow of a ship. Signed in plate, lower right.

label: Description
value: Narrow brown diagonal bands form a diaper pattern at the intersections of which are blue four-pointed motifs resembling stars. At the center of the open spaces of the diaper are brown diamond-shaped figures. Printed on cream ground.

label: Provenance
value: From a house in South Norwalk, Connecticut, demolished 1952. 289 Ely Avenue, South Norwalk. House was over 200 years old.

label: Description
value: Unrelated pieces sewn together so that two yellow guard borders appear on the right and left of a dark green field section which has floral sprays in let-in wools in red and beige shading into pale blue (painted?) blue-green and tan with silk chain-stitch outlines and details in beige, yellow and orange.  Guard borders have a design of alternately up and down turned flower heads in scallops of serpentining stem in the same technique. Couched striped silk cords set off guard strip and field except at modern joining.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool and silk Technique: piecing, embroidery and couching
Proposed Railroad for Broadway, New York City

label: Description
value: Vignette at upper right, view looking down.  Broadway with Trinity Church in the distance.  Proposed rail line is shown in place.  Section of track, and views of cars, upper left.

label: Description
value: The editor is seated at his desk, facing left with editions of Harper's Weekly hanging on racks behind him. Seated on the floor, facing right in profile, is the artist himself depicted as a young child. The artist is sharpening his pencil, with a drawing block spread across his knees.

label: Provenance
value: Norvin Hewitt Green, New York, NY; 1938: Cooper Union Library, New York, NY; 1953: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A three-quarter length portrait of Peter Cooper, facing right. He is seated in an armchair, his cane held in his right hand.

label: Provenance
value: Norvin Hewitt Green; Cooper Union Library; 1953: acquired by Museum
Membership Certificate, Society of Journeymen Cabinet-Makers

label: Description
value: An escutcheon relating to cabinet-making in center, flanked by desk and chair. Below, legend with the recipient, John Hewitt; Secretary W. Philip; Chairman Edward Barkhouse and date written with pen and brown ink. Red wax seal on bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving, pen and brown ink, sealing wax on paper

label: Description
value: Presented as a globe on a stand, the surface arranged in concentric rings, with radiating divisions.

label: Description
value: A gilt wood and metal casket depicting a scene. Oblong box with projecting base and cover, four flattened ball feet, and rosette and round knob-sides and cover gilt and punch-marked.  Moulded and carved reliefs representing on front the Calydonian Boar Hunt; on back, the Judgment of Paris; on sides, the Baptism of the Samarians by Philip and Judith.  On cover, two pairs of winged genii holding wreaths.  Pilasters on corners, acanthus moulding on base and lower part of cover.  Moulding with oak leaves on cover, which is hinged to body with simple eyelet hinges.  Part of snap lock on front--corresponding part on cover missing.

label: Provenance
value: 1953: acquired by Museum (from Mr. Perry B. Cott)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
Christ in Limbo (The Harrowing of Hell)

label: Description
value: Christ is in the foreground, kneeling, facing right in profile. He extends His right hand toward two figures appearing in an archway, below. A group of figures stand in the background. Demons at upper left.
Rail Road Suspension Bridge near Niagara Falls

label: Description
value: The bridge in the middleground between the American and Canadian banks of the Niagara River.  The two levels of the bridge are indicated, a train appears on upper level with carriages on the lower level.  The Falls are in the background.

label: Description
value:
Horizontal rectangle.  Panorama of the city in the background.  A section of Governor's Island in the foreground, right, showing part of Castle Williams.  Below, center:  "New York, From Governor's Island / No. 20 of the Hudson River Port Folio. / Published by Henry I. Megarey New York."
At lower left:  "Painted by W. G. Wall."  
At lower right:  "Engraved by I. HIll."

label: Description
value: View of main entrance of Cooper Union Building as seen from the northwest corner of Astor Place and approximately Fourth Avenue in Manhattan.

label: Description
value: Netted white silk ornamented with cut steel beads in small star and anchor motifs and a larger triple zigzag pattern. Two faceted steel rings control side closing; small cut steel drops at each end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal beads Technique: metal beads sewn to white silk machine-made net using running stitch.

label: Description
value: White silk purse ornamented with cut steel beads in zigzag and diamond patterns. Two steel rings with raised ball pattern, control side opening; tassels of steel bars and beads at either end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, steel Technique: knotted netting

label: Description
value: Small flat purse of fine colored beads, in a horizontal pattern of rose garland and buds, in white, red, blue and green. Athe top a section of dark red through which pass two little bars with coral tips. Gold chain, broken.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, glass beads, metal Technique: beaded knitting

label: Description
value: Rose crocheted silk with fine cut steel beads; steel ring and bars at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: beaded crochet

label: Description
value: Rose color silk net, crocheted; ornamented with cut steal beads. Steel ring to slide and close. Fitted at top with small ivory or bone bars to open. Cut steel pendant; steel chain to carry.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal, ivory/bone Technique: beaded, crochet

label: Description
value: Crocheted black silk embroidered with small red and green squares, outlined in steel beads.  More steel beads form bars and crosses.  Side closing controlled by two steel rings; steel bead tassels at each end of purse.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: crochet, embroidery
